CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 5 - Right to liberty and security (Article 5-3 - Reasonableness of pre-trial detention);Violation of Article 5 - Right to liberty and security (Article 5-4 - Review of lawfulness of detention)
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and is detained in GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE he was arrested on suspicion of murder .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Vyborgskiy ORG of GPE authorised the applicant ’s pre - trial detention . He remained in custody pending investigation and trial .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG extended the applicant ’s pretrial detention . The court referred to the gravity of charges , the applicant ’s character , lack of permanent residence in GPE , and risk of absconding or re - offending .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG returned the case to the prosecutor and extended the applicant ’s detention without specifying any reasons .
CARDINAL . On DATE , DATE and DATE when extending pre - trial detention , ORG reproduced the grounds for detention described above .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Saint - Petersburg City Court quashed the detention order of DATE and remitted the case for a fresh examination .

CARDINAL . On DATE , CARDINAL DATE and DATE ORG extended the applicant ’s detention referring to the gravity of charges , absence of permanent residence , his character , possibility of absconding and committing crimes . The applicant and his lawyer did not attend the hearing on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Vyborgskiy District Court of GPE convicted the applicant of murder and theft .

CARDINAL . On DATE FAC upheld his conviction on appeal . As regards the applicant ’s appeal against the detention order of DATE , the court noted that the lower court had failed to ensure the applicant ’s and his lawyer ’s presence at the hearing of DATE . However , in view of the applicant ’s conviction , it discontinued the appeal proceedings finding them unnecessary .
